item.title: Race Across the World - Series 3: Episode 1
item.description: Five teams set off from Vancouver on a race across Canada. Without smartphones, internet access or credit cards, they will need plenty of ingenuity to make it to the finish line in Newfoundland.

item.title: Gossip Girl (2021-23) - Series 2: 1. Deb Brawl in a Blue Dress
item.description: New Year, new start, and there's a new Queen of Constance. But the new Julien doesn't plan on doing anything about it.

item.title: Stacey Dooley - Ready for War?
item.description: Stacey follows three Ukrainian civilians training with British soldiers to fight Russia. In just five weeks, a florist, a welder and a jeweller learn to 'survive and be lethal'.

item.title: Breakfast - 13/04/2023
item.description: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

item.title: Colin from Accounts - Series 1: 1. The Flash
item.description: Gordon’s day goes from bad to worse when, distracted by the impulsive actions of an attractive stranger, Ashley, he accidentally hits a stray dog with his car.

item.title: Rain Dogs - Series 1: 1. It's Hard to Be a Saint in the City
item.description: Facing eviction from their flat, single mum Costello and daughter Iris scramble to find housing before nightfall. Selby's return from prison receives mixed reactions.

item.title: Made Up in Belfast - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Excitement is high as Love Island winner Ekin-Su joins the team travelling to Dublin to launch a brand new make-up range and flagship store.

item.title: MasterChef - Series 19: Episode 1
item.description: Nine cooks face an audition test in which they must cook a Family Favourite dish, and an invention test. Seven will progress to the next round, and two will be eliminated.

item.title: Blue Lights - Series 1: 1. The Code
item.description: PSNI probationer Grace promises to help Angela, whose son has fallen in with a notorious gang. But with undercover agents watching, will she be able to keep her word?

item.title: Great Expectations - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Through a twist of fate, Pip, an orphan who yearns for a greater lot in life, meets the mysterious and eccentric Miss Havisham, who shows him a dark world of possibilities.

item.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr - Series 4: Episode 1
item.description: Ten budding interior designers are challenged to transform luxury apartments in London’s Elephant and Castle. Hosted by Alan Carr.

item.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars - Series 2: Episode 1
item.description: Gordon invites 12 food and drink entrepreneurs to Glenapp Castle in Scotland, where he challenges them to create banquets celebrating his homeland. Can they meet his exacting standards?

item.title: Magpie Murders - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Susan Ryeland, the editor of best-selling crime writer Alan Conway, is drawn into her own mystery when Conway is found dead and the last chapter of his new manuscript missing.

item.title: Project Icon: The UK’s Next Music Star - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Ten of the UK’s most promising unsigned artists head to Manchester to attempt to convince the judges that they have everything it takes to cut through in today’s music industry.

item.title: The Apprentice Australia - Series 2: Episode 1
item.description: Lord Sugar heads down under to meet the 16 celebrities battling it out to win money for their charities, avoid being fired and be crowned Australia’s Celebrity Apprentice.

item.title: EastEnders - 10/04/2023
item.description: Kim fights for her relationship with Howie, Ricky grapples with the enormity of being a dad, and Eve’s jealousy gets the better of her.

item.title: Lost: Those Who Kill - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Danish crime thriller. Criminal profiler Louise Bergstein is asked to help in the investigation into the brutal murder of a middle-aged couple.

item.title: Love, Faith and Me - Series 1: 4. Married, Sikh and Wanting a Baby
item.description: Sarina and Vik have always wanted children, but finding it difficult, they’re now looking for alternative ways to conceive. Can Sikhism help at this emotionally challenging time?

item.title: Designing the Hebrides - Series 1: 1. Fish Shop
item.description: Banjo and his team get to transform a much-loved family-run fish shop on the Isle of Mull. He has bold ambitions, but can he convince the owners to trust his daring designs?

item.title: Elon Musk talks to the BBC -
item.description: The exclusive spontaneous interview with Elon Musk & the BBC's James Clayton.

item.title: Wild Isles - Series 1: 1. Our Precious Isles
item.description: David Attenborough celebrates the rich variety of habitats in our wild isles, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe.

item.title: Reunion Hotel - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Tegan fell on the Tube tracks and wants to meet the man who saved her, Lee hopes to find the brother he didn’t know he had, and a little girl thanks builders who changed her life.

item.title: Inside the Factory - Series 7: Pork Pies
item.description: Gregg Wallace explores the Vale of Mowbray pork pie factory, which began making pork pies in 1928. Cherry Healey reveals hacks for the perfect vegan shortcrust pastry.

item.title: Last Woman on Earth with Sara Pascoe - Series 2: 1. Greece
item.description: Sara Pascoe returns with her travelogue about the world’s endangered jobs. In Greece, she meets a monk, a family of bell makers and villagers who communicate by whistling.

item.title: Dog Days - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Homeless Zoso steals a guitar to earn money for his daughter’s birthday present and is filmed by one of the locals impressed by his soulful voice.

item.title: Highland Cops - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: A bushcraft expert is reported missing in remote Sutherland. The officers battle to uncover which route he took before a blizzard sets in.

item.title: Get On Up: The Triumph of Black America - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Actor David Harewood travels across America to discover the stories behind his heroes, the artistic pioneers from the 1960s to the 1990s who shaped popular culture.

item.title: Parole - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: 54-year-old Colin committed a brutal murder 25 years ago. With his victim's widow waiting anxiously for the decision, will the parole board decide that he is safe to be let back into the community?

item.title: The Cockfields - Series 1: Episode 1: Friday
item.description: Simon's taking girlfriend Donna to meet his family for the first time.

item.title: Facelift - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: An insight into the lives of Dr Darren McKeown and husband Tom as they navigate a big year running a cosmetic clinic, building a luxurious cosmetic hospital and having their first child.

item.title: Dragons' Den - Series 20: Episode 1
item.description: Facing the Dragons tonight are a young cancer survivor with a stylish pillbox alternative, and two school friends who believe they’ve spotted a gap in the skincare market.

item.title: The Apprentice - Series 17: 1. Antigua Tourism
item.description: Lord Sugar’s candidates touch down on the Caribbean island of Antigua to sell and run bespoke tours. Then, back in Blighty, one candidate is sent packing.

item.title: Love, Faith and Me - Series 1: 3. Our Supersized Christian Family
item.description: Alex and Amy have five children under five, including identical triplets. Can their Christian faith and community help them juggle a chaotic home-life now they're both back at work?

item.title: Burt Bacharach: A Tribute from Ronnie Scott’s -
item.description: World-famous jazz club Ronnie Scott’s hosts a tribute to Burt Bacharach - a songwriter, producer and pianist who is widely seen as one of the most important songwriters of the 20th century.

item.title: The Moment of Proof - Series 3: Episode 1
item.description: A fingerprint from an old break-in solves a murder at the same factory months later. Elsewhere, a DNA spray means police can finally apprehend a prolific motorbike thief.

item.title: Endgame in Ireland - Series 1: 1. Bomb and the Ballot Box
item.description: In April 1981, Bobby Sands, an IRA prisoner on hunger strike, won a seat at Westminster, inadvertently starting the endgame in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Simon Reeve's Return to Cornwall -
item.description: Simon Reeve is back to visit one of Britain’s favourite counties to discover what life is really like for the locals after the summer crowds have gone.

item.title: The Repair Shop - Series 12: Episode 1
item.description: The team restores a Ukrainian painting which survived a WWII labour camp and a 1960s bookings calendar from Liverpool's Cavern Club, which records an early Beatles performance.

item.title: Anton & Giovanni’s Adventures in Sicily - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: The first leg of Anton and Giovanni’s Sicilian road trip begins in the port town of Sciacca. From there, it takes in Greek architecture, octopus fishing and a tango festival.

item.title: Shetland - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Two-part murder mystery set on the Shetland Islands. DI Perez investigates when elderly Shetlander Mima Wilson is murdered on the archaeological site in the grounds of her croft.

item.title: Happy Valley - Series 3: Episode 1
item.description: When Catherine discovers the remains of a murder victim, it bizarrely leads her straight back to Tommy Lee Royce.

item.title: Luther - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Crime drama series. Luther, back from suspension, must solve a seemingly perfect double murder and work out how, and by whom, it was committed.

item.title: A Very British Cult -
item.description: Catrin Nye investigates a life coaching company that takes over your life. As the story hots up, they fight back, and there’s a surreal final showdown.

item.title: Herself -
item.description: After escaping from her abusive husband, Sandra finds herself on a long waiting for housing. She spots a website which, with a little help from friends old and new, changes her life.

item.title: Stronger -
item.description: Based on the true story of Jeff Bauman, a 27-year-old, working-class man who was at the 2013 Boston Marathon to try and win back his ex-girlfriend Erin.

item.title: The Graduate -
item.description: An aimless college graduate finds himself torn between his older lover and her daughter.

item.title: Eternal Beauty -
item.description: Having long lived with depression and paranoid schizophrenia, Jane encounters new sources of love and joy after meeting the flamboyant but equally troubled Mike.

item.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron -
item.description: Superhero sequel. Iron Man, Captain America, Thor, the Hulk, Black Widow and Hawkeye all spring into action when a rogue Stark Industries experiment threatens to destroy the world.

item.title: The Sound of Music -
item.description: Classic film version of the Rodgers and Hammerstein musical in which a novice nun (Julie Andrews) leaves her convent to accept a position as governess to a large family.

item.title: Blade Runner 2049 -
item.description: After making a disturbing discovery, replicant hunter K goes after the one person he suspects can help.

item.title: A Million Little Pieces -
item.description: A drug-dependent young man faces his past and his inner demons after he is interned in an institution for the addicted.

item.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves -
item.description: On his return from the Crusades, Robin of Locksley learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare.

item.title: Doctor Who - Series 13: 1. The Halloween Apocalypse
item.description: On Halloween, all across the universe, terrifying forces are stirring. The life of Dan Lewis is about to change forever. Why is the Doctor chasing Karvanista? What is the Flux?

item.title: Safe Haven -
item.description: Drama. The mysterious Katie moves to a quiet village in North Carolina, where she is slowly letting love back into her life. But then the secrets from her past come to the surface.

item.title: Waterloo Road - Series 11: Episode 1
item.description: When the students begin fighting back and a full-on rebellion threatens to disrupt any sense of order, headteacher Kim Campbell is forced into drastic action.

item.title: Gavin & Stacey - Series 1: Episode 1
item.description: Comedy series about Essex boy Gavin and Welsh lass Stacey. After being phone buddies for months Gavin and Stacey finally manage to arrange a rendezvous in Leicester Square.

item.title: Wild Isles - Saving Our Wild Isles
item.description: In a special documentary commissioned by the RSPB, WWF and National Trust and inspired by Wild Isles, we meet passionate people trying to restore nature to the British Isles.

item.title: Bluey - Series 2: 52. Easter
item.description: Bluey finds a series of clues that lead the girls on an Easter egg treasure hunt.

item.title: Nick Cope's Popcast - Series 3: 1. Bees
item.description: Nick and the Popcasters create the perfect song to help a very tired bee get its buzz back.

item.title: Octonauts - Series 5: 1. Blue Fin Tuna
item.description: The Octonauts must find a way to help an injured tuna catch up with her school, before they speed out of reach.

item.title: Just William - Series 1: 1. The Sweet Little Girl in White
item.description: Children's comedy. The Botts move into Croombe Hall, with a few surprises for William and his friends - not least their daughter, Violet-Elizabeth.

item.title: Monster Loving Maniacs - Series 1: 1. Welcome to Gruselbrook - Part 1
item.description: Three monster-loving kids visit their grandfather in the most haunted city on earth.

item.title: A Kind of Spark - Series 1: 1. The Spark
item.description: Addie has a meltdown on a school trip and finds a strange witch jar. It’s the start of a life-changing adventure full of friendship, frenemies and a mystery that must be solved.
